en: You went wandering again today, and because of that Sandra considered keeping you in tonight and not sending you on the bachelor’s party.
zh: 你今天又溜出去了，所以桑德拉打算今晚讓你留在家裡，不去參加什麼單身派對了。

en: You didn’t really care one way or the other, but in the end she decided she wanted you to go. Probably so she could get you out of the house for obvious reasons.
zh: 不過最終她還是決定讓你去，或許這是為數不多可以讓你離開家的合理原因了。

en: No doubt the party became more raucous once the old-timers had gone, that Rick and his friends drunk their way along to a strip joint, but for you it was just dinner and no wine but water, some overcooked chicken, and a soggy salad.
zh: 不過一旦長輩不在場了，派對就變得更加熱鬧。瑞克和他的朋友們都喝高了，派對幾乎變成了脫衣舞俱樂部。不過對你來說，這隻是一頓晚飯而已，你沒有飲酒，只是喝了點水，吃了些雞肉和沙拉。

en: You sat there pretending not to notice the whispered comments and not-so-subtle nods in your direction.
zh: 你坐在那裡假裝沒有注意到那些竊竊私語、評頭論足，或沖你這邊那些微妙的點頭。

en: You were the guy with Alzheimer’s, and to them that made you a joke.
zh: 你是阿爾茨海默病病人，對他們而言，這隻會讓你成為笑柄。

en: It made you a joke because they would never be like you, the same way you used to think you would never be like this, and what could be funnier than your mate’s father-in-law losing his mind at forty-nine and occasionally going off to Batshit County for long walks in Batshit Park?
zh: 他們不會喜歡你的，你以前也以為自己絕不會成為現在這個樣子。有什麼能比你朋友的岳父在四十九歲喪失心智，跑到瘋人縣的瘋人公園裡遊盪更滑稽可笑呢？

en: You were home by ten and are keeping your promise to ride the sober train all the way to Eva’s wedding.
zh: 你到家時已經十點了，你保證過要一直保持清醒，直到伊娃舉行完婚禮。

en: So. The wandering. That’s what you want to know about, right?
zh: 所以，你想知道一些關於遊盪的事，對不對？

en: Well, there are a couple of things. If you’re going to wander, take a wallet with you.
zh: 嗯，比如以下幾點：如果你溜出去了，就帶著錢包，這樣可以證明身份。

en: It’s good if you can identify yourself, and even better if you can pay for a taxi or a bus. Money is good—so keep it on you.
zh: 很好，還有更好的，那就是你還知道支付計程車費，上了公共汽車還知道買車票。

en: Just as good is a phone. Try to take your phone with you.
zh: 手機也是好東西，要帶著手機。

en: A bottle of water would be good too—helps with the dehydration, and who knows how far you can walk?
zh: 瓶裝水也是好東西，口渴時大有用處，誰知道你會走多遠呢？

en: Today you snuck out the window to avoid the house alarms, and the thing is, you have no memory of doing it.
zh: 今天你悄悄翻出窗外，沒有觸發房屋裡的警報器，不過你對此毫無記憶。

en: You have no idea if the intent was there to go for a walk on your own, or to go and buy flowers, or to do any number of possible things a man will do once he leaves his home with barely enough cash to buy a hamburger combo.
zh: 你不知道你是打算一個人出去散散步呢，還是去買花，或者只是看看一個人離開家、身上只帶著夠買一份漢堡的錢能幹什麼。

en: You don’t know which version of Jerry made that decision, or which version of Jerry showed up at the florist where Belinda works.
zh: 你不知道哪個時段的傑瑞會做出上述的哪種決定，或者哪個時段的傑瑞會出現在貝琳達的花店中。

en: The florist is in town, right between the two main drags of Manchester and Colombo.
zh: 花店在市區，正位於曼徹斯特和科倫坡兩站之間。

en: And how did you get there?
zh: 你是怎麼到達那裡的？

en: A true magician never reveals his tricks, Jerry, and Captain A is nothing but the master of slight of hand. Look over here while he wipes Jerry’s mind!
zh: 就算是個真正的魔術師也很難揭穿這個把戲，傑瑞，而「阿爾茨船長」則是戲法大師，他會直接抹去傑瑞的記憶！

en: Belinda asked if you were okay, and you told her you were, because you really were okay, Future Jerry, you were on a mission, one so top secret even you didn’t know the agenda.
zh: 貝琳達問你好不好，你說你很好。你真的很好，未來的傑瑞，你正擔負著一項使命，這是絕對的機密，哪怕你連日程安排都忘了也不可以泄露出去。

en: She knew about the Big A (it seems everybody does), and she sat you down in the office and made you a cup of tea and rang Sandra and told her she would drive you home.
zh: 她知道你患上了阿爾茨海默病（似乎每個人都知道），她請你到辦公室里坐下，給你倒了杯茶，然後給桑德拉打了個電話，告訴她，她會開車送你回家。

en: By this time Captain A was releasing the reins a little, and you were becoming equally aware and embarrassed of the situation.
zh: 此時，「阿爾茨船長」鬆開了纜繩，讓你縱情地想象，你忽然懂得了何為世故人情，面對眼下這個情形有些尷尬不安。

en: Belinda kept smiling at you, and told you not to worry, that her grandmother has Alzheimer’s and she’s used to it, which actually upset you because it made you feel so old.
zh: 貝琳達一直衝著你微笑，告訴你不要擔心，又說她奶奶就患有阿爾茨海默病，她早已習慣了。這讓你有些心煩意亂，她這麼說讓你覺得自己一下子老了很多。

en: She swung past her house on the way to pick up something for Eva that she would have been dropping off later in the day anyway, which is why she was happy to drop you home.
zh: 路上的時候，她開車拐回家順便給伊娃拿些東西。她本來就打算晚些時候帶過去，這也是她很高興送你回家的原因。

en: She asked if you would be okay waiting in the car, and you said yes, and that bit you remember, but then Captain A tightened the reins a little and Belinda found you sitting on the back doorstep talking to her cat a few minutes later.
zh: 她問，你在車上等她可不可以，你說沒問題，但隨後「阿爾茨船長」收緊纜繩，幾分鐘后貝琳達發現你坐在後門口跟她的貓說話。

en: Sandra was worried sick by the time you got back to the house.
zh: 你到家了，桑德拉都快擔心死了。

en: She’d been getting ready to call the police just before Belinda phoned her.
zh: 貝琳達給她打電話時，她正準備報警。

en: The net result is alarms are being put on all the windows.
zh: 最終結果是所有的窗戶都會安裝警報器。

en: If that doesn’t work, then perhaps the next step is to have a GPS chip sewn into your back where you can’t reach it.
zh: 如果還是不行的話，也許下一步就要在你的背部縫入一個GPS晶元，你夠不到它的。

en: Good news—the wedding is close now.
zh: 好消息：婚禮就要到了。

en: There’s the rehearsal in a few hours, and remember—practice, practice, practice.
zh: 你們每天都排練幾個小時。記住，練習、練習、再練習。

en: Bad news—Sandra said earlier, I can’t wait for all of this to be over.
zh: 壞消息：桑德拉之前說過：「我等不到這一切都結束的時候了。」

en: When you asked what she meant by that, she sighed, and said, What do you think, Jerry?
zh: 你問她是什麼意思，她嘆了口氣，說：「你覺得呢，傑瑞？」

en: Honestly? You don’t think she’s just referring to the wedding.
zh: 說實話呢，你覺得她不只是指婚禮的事。

en: Jerry’s cell phone is still ringing. It echoes around the bathroom.
zh: 傑瑞的手機鈴聲仍在響，回蕩在廁所里。

en: He stares at the stall where a few minutes ago he was sitting, as if by looking longer and harder the bag with the towel and knife will reappear.
zh: 他盯著幾分鐘前待過的那個隔間，彷彿看的時間越長、注意力越集中，裝毛巾和刀的塑料袋就會重新出現。

en: He heads into the corridor and answers the phone.
zh: 他走進走廊，接起電話。

en: “Where are you?” Hans asks.
zh: 「你在哪裡？」漢斯問。

en: “The bathroom.”
zh: 「廁所。」

en: “I told you to wait outside.”
zh: 「我告訴你在外面等著。」

en: “I’m heading there now.”
zh: 「我這就過去。」

en: He hangs up.
zh: 他掛斷了電話。

en: He almost drops the phone when he puts it into his pocket because his hands are shaking so much.
zh: 把手機裝進口袋時，手機差一點兒掉到地上，他的手抖得厲害。

en: Hans isn’t there, not right away, but then ten seconds later he is, pulling up in a dark blue SUV.
zh: 漢斯不在，至少現在不在。十秒后，他出現了，坐在一輛深藍色的運動型多用途車裡。

en: Hans leans over and opens the door and Jerry climbs in.
zh: 他慢慢把車停下，探過身來，打開車門，傑瑞爬上了汽車。

en: He drops the supermarket bag on the floor between his feet. He wipes his sweaty hands on his jacket.
zh: 他把超市購物袋放在兩腳之間的座位底下，又把汗津津的手在外套上蹭了蹭。

en: “Jesus, Jerry, you look terrible.”
zh: 「天啊，傑瑞，你看起來真的很糟糕。」

en: Hans doesn’t need to be told twice. They move smoothly through the parking lot past other cars, turning into and out of parking spaces.
zh: 不必再跟漢斯說第二遍了，他們順利地在停車場里超過其他車，駛出停車場。

en: “You got a destination in mind?
zh: 「你心中有目的地了嗎？

en: The nursing home?”
zh: 回療養院？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: Jerry stares at his friend while thinking of an answer.
zh: 傑瑞看著他的朋友，心裏考慮著目的地。

en: He has put on more weight than the Hans he remembers.
zh: 眼前的漢斯比記憶中的胖了許多。

en: It looks like he has a few more tattoos poking out from beneath his collar too.
zh: 他脖子上又多出幾處文身，從他的衣領下顯露出來。

en: This Hans has evolved so much from the one he first met in university.
zh: 眼前的漢斯和他在大學第一次見到的漢斯區別竟然這麼大了。

en: “Not the nursing home,” Jerry says.
zh: 「不是療養院。」傑瑞說，「離開這裏就好。」

en: “Tell me what happened,” Hans says.
zh: 「告訴我發生了什麼事？」漢斯說。

en: Jerry leans back. His legs are jittering, his knees popping up and down.
zh: 傑瑞靠在座椅上，雙腿顫抖，膝蓋忽上忽下。

en: They exit the parking lot.
zh: 他們離開了停車場。

en: “I’m not . . .
zh: 「我不能……我不能完全肯定。」

en: I’m not entirely sure,” he says, which sums up his life these days pretty well, he thinks.
zh: 他說。這話很好地總結了他這幾天的生活，他心想。

en: “I escaped the nursing home.”
zh: 「我是從療養院里逃出來的。」

en: “You’ve done that a few times now.”
zh: 「你已經溜出來很多次了。」

en: “They keep you updated?”
zh: 「他們都告訴你了？」

en: “Eva keeps me updated on your progress,” Hans says.
zh: 「伊娃告訴我你進步很多。」漢斯說。

en: “It’s not progress,” Jerry says. “It’s the exact opposite of progress. It’s . . . is there a word for that?”
zh: 「不是進步，」傑瑞說，「恰恰是進步的反義詞，是……有一個什麼詞來著？」

en: “You want to tell me what happened, or do you just want me to drive around aimlessly?”
zh: 漢斯說，「你是想告訴我發生了什麼事呢，還是你只是想讓我漫無目的地開車瞎逛呢？」

en: “Let’s put the air-conditioning on,” Jerry says, and he starts fiddling with the controls but to no avail.
zh: 「打開空調吧。」傑瑞說，他開始控制和整理自己的思緒，但無濟於事。

en: His hands are still sweaty. “It’s a hundred and fifty degrees in here.”
zh: 他的手心還在冒汗，「這裏得有五十攝氏度了。」

en: Cool air comes through the vents and Jerry holds his hands in front of them. “Maybe if you took your jacket off you’d feel better. Jerry?”
zh: 漢斯說，並輕輕按動一個開關，通風口便吹出陣陣涼風，傑瑞把雙手伸到通風口前面，「或者也許你把外套脫了會更舒服一點兒，傑瑞。」

en: Jerry reaches into the bag for his water.
zh: 傑瑞把手伸進購物袋裡拿水。

en: “Jerry?”
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: He gets the lid off. He gulps down a mouthful, then another, so quickly his throat hurts.
zh: 他擰開瓶蓋，吞下一口，再吞下一口，喉嚨一陣刺痛。

en: “Jerry?”
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: He wipes his hand across his mouth. He looks at his friend. “It’s possible I killed somebody,” he says.
zh: 他用手擦擦嘴，看著他的朋友，說：「我可能殺了一個人。」

en: Hans looks over at him. “What?
zh: 漢斯上下打量著他：「什麼？

en: Jesus, Jerry, what?”
zh: 天啊，傑瑞，你在說什麼？」

en: Jerry turns the air-conditioning off. He suddenly feels cold. “I woke up in a house I’ve never been in before, and there was a woman there.”
zh: 傑瑞關閉空調，他忽然感到一絲絲寒意：「我今天醒來，發現自己在一間之前從來沒有去過的房子里，而且那裡還有一個女人。」

en: His words start to speed up. “She was naked and lying on the lounge floor. She’d been stabbed.”
zh: 他的語速開始加快了，「她赤|裸裸地躺在客廳的地板上，被人刺死了。」

en: “Oh thank God,” Hans says, and he smiles, and looks genuinely relieved, and that reaction is completely opposite to what Jerry was expecting.
zh: 「哦，感謝老天。」漢斯說，他微笑起來，好像是真的鬆了一口氣，這反應與傑瑞所期待的完全相反。

en: Is this all some kind of joke to him?
zh: 難道他以為他是在開玩笑？

en: “Trust me, everything is going to be okay.”
zh: 「相信我，會沒事的。」

en: “I found her that way, but I didn’t do it.
zh: 「我看見她那個樣子……但不是我乾的。

en: Somebody is trying to set me up, but I don’t know why.”
zh: 有人想陷害我，但我不知道為什麼。」

en: “Calm down,” Hans says, and he checks his mirror, he indicates, and then he turns the corner and parks on the side of a quieter street in the shade.
zh: 「冷靜一下。」漢斯說。他看了一眼鏡子，然後驅車轉了個彎，在一條安靜的街道上把車停在路邊的林蔭處。

en: He takes his seat belt off and twists in his seat so he can face Jerry.
zh: 他鬆開安全帶，在座位上扭過身來，這樣他就可以面對傑瑞了。

en: “You didn’t kill anybody.
zh: 「你沒有殺任何人。

en: You know what you used to do for a living, right?”
zh: 你知道你以前是靠什麼吃飯的，對吧？」

en: “Of course I know, but that isn’t about this.”
zh: 「我當然知道，但不是說這個。」

en: “You wrote crime novels,” Hans says.
zh: 「你寫犯罪小說。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry is shaking his head. “I know.
zh: 傑瑞搖搖頭：「我知道。

en: But like I said, this—”
zh: 但就像我說的，這個……」

en: “Very good ones too,” Hans says, interrupting him. “People were always saying how real they felt.
zh: 「書寫得很精彩，」漢斯打斷他，「人們總是說那些故事如何如何真實。

en: So if they felt real to other people, Jerry, how do you think they felt to you?”
zh: 所以，要是其他人都感覺如此真實了，傑瑞，你會怎麼想呢？」

en: “This isn’t like those other times.”
zh: 「有時不是這樣的。」

en: “You’ve been confessing to crimes that were in your books.
zh: 「你一直在懺悔你在書里描寫的罪行。

en: These are all—”
zh: 這些都——」

en: “You’re not listening to me,” Jerry says, fighting the frustration.
zh: 「你沒有聽我說。」傑瑞無奈地說。「我在聽。」

en: “No you’re not,” he says, and he opens the jacket to reveal his bloody shirt. “I didn’t do it.
zh: 他說著解開外套，露出血淋淋的襯衫來，「不是我乾的。

en: I was there, but I didn’t do it.”
zh: 我是在那裡，但不是我乾的。」

en: Hans says nothing.
zh: 漢斯沒有說什麼。

en: He drums his fingers on the steering wheel while he stares at the blood, and after a while he stares out the windshield.
zh: 他凝視著血跡，在方向盤上敲動著手指，過了一會兒，他透過後擋風玻璃向外凝望。

en: Jerry lets him think. He can’t remember this morning, but he can remember that Hans likes to really think things through.
zh: 傑瑞看著他凝神思考，他不記得今天早上發生的事，但他記得漢斯喜歡探究事情的來龍去脈。

en: He takes another mouthful of water then puts the bottle back into the bag.
zh: 他又喝了口水，然後把瓶子放回購物袋。

en: Finally Hans looks at him. “Are you sure about this?”
zh: 漢斯看著他說：「你確定嗎？」

en: “Somebody is going to find her soon and the police are going to think it was me.”
zh: 傑瑞說，「人們很快就會發現她的屍體，警察會認為是我乾的。」

en: Hans shakes his head. “Listen to me, trust me, this is all some plot out of one of your—”
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭：「聽我說，相信我，這些都是你書中的情節——」

en: Jerry shakes his head. “You’re still not listening.
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭：「你還是沒有聽。

en: They already think I killed somebody, and I’m not talking about Sandra.”
zh: 他們已經認定我殺人了，我不是在說桑德拉。」

en: “You know about Sandra?”
zh: 「你知道桑德拉死了？」

en: “That she’s dead?
zh: 「我知道她死了？

en: Yes.
zh: 是的。

en: That I killed her?
zh: 是我殺了她嗎？

en: No. It wasn’t me, but that’s not who I’m talking about.
zh: 不，不是我，我說的也不是她。

en: Yesterday I had to go to the police station,” Jerry says, and of course he doesn’t really know it was yesterday—maybe it was last week.
zh: 昨天，我去了警察局。」傑瑞說，當然，他並不知道這個昨天可能是上個禮拜或者是上個月。

en: Or last month. “This other woman the police questioned me about, she was the florist for Eva’s wedding.”
zh: 「警察向我問起另一個女人了，她是花店老闆，曾經為伊娃的婚禮準備鮮花。」

en: “Oh shit,” Hans says.
zh: 「媽的。」漢斯說。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “They’re asking you about Belinda Murray,” Hans says, and here comes the concern Jerry expected from him two minutes ago.
zh: 「他們在問你貝琳達·穆雷。」漢斯說著，臉上露出關切的神情，兩分鐘前傑瑞就希望看到這副表情。

en: “You know her? Wait, wait, did I know her?”
zh: 「你認識她？等等，等等，我也認識她？」

en: Hans doesn’t look just concerned but worried too. He starts drumming his fingers faster.
zh: 漢斯的神情看起來不僅是關切，還摻雜著擔憂，他的手指敲擊得更迅速了。

en: He checks over his shoulder as if looking for somebody watching them.
zh: 他扭頭回身，彷彿是在找暗中監視著他們的人。

en: “You took . . . well, you took quite a liking to her.
zh: 「你對她特別感興趣……

en: You wandered out of your house once and went to see her at work.”
zh: 好吧，其實是你喜歡上她了。有一次，你從家裡溜了出去，在她工作時去看望她。」

en: Jerry shakes his head.
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭：「你在扯淡。」

en: “You’re making that up,” he says, trying to figure out a reason why Hans would, and coming to the conclusion he wouldn’t. “Even if you’re not, visiting her at work isn’t the same as killing her.”
zh: 他想找出漢斯為什麼會扯淡騙他，結果他得出結論，他不會騙他的，「即使你沒有扯淡，在她工作時去看望她也不等同於殺害她。」

en: “You’re right, it’s not the same,” Hans says, and he looks away.
zh: 「你說得對，這不一樣。」漢斯說。

en: He stops drumming his fingers.
zh: 他看著遠處，手指停止了敲擊。

en: “What?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「什麼？」傑瑞問。

en: “Nothing.”
zh: 「沒什麼。」

en: “Come on, there’s clearly something you’re not telling me.”
zh: 「好吧，顯然有些事情你沒有告訴我。」

en: Hans turns back towards him. “It’s like you said, Jerry, it’s not the same.”
zh: 漢斯轉過身，面對著他：「就像你說的，傑瑞，這是不一樣的。」

en: Jerry shakes his head. “Just tell me.”
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭：「你就告訴我嘛。」

en: Hans shrugs, then sighs, then runs his hand over his smooth head. “Well, the thing is, Jerry, you also visited her at home.”
zh: 漢斯聳聳肩，然後嘆了口氣，用手摸了摸他的頭：「好吧，事情是這樣的，傑瑞，你還去了她家。」

en: “What do you mean I visited her at home?”
zh: 「你的意思是我去她家裡看她了？」

en: “I mean exactly how that sounds.
zh: 「我的意思就是這樣。

en: It was when you went to see her at work.
zh: 你在她工作時去看她。

en: She gave you a lift back to your house, but she swung by her house too.
zh: 她開車送你回家，但她又順便拐到她家去了。

en: So you knew where she lived.”
zh: 所以，你知道她住在哪裡。」

en: Jerry keeps shaking his head. It can’t be true.
zh: 傑瑞不斷地搖頭，這不可能是真的。

en: However, there are so many things happening that seem impossible, yet he knows they aren’t.
zh: 然而，發生了這麼多看似不可能的事情，但他知道事實並非如此。

en: Things like waking up this morning in the home of a dead woman, to finding a bloody shirt under the floorboards of his house.
zh: 比如，在今天早上醒來，發現自己與一具女屍獨處一室；再比如，在自己家的地板下發現一件帶血的襯衫。

en: “They never found her killer,” Hans says.
zh: 「他們沒有找到兇手。」漢斯說。

en: “You think I did it?”
zh: 「你覺得是我乾的？」

en: “I’m not saying that,” Hans says.
zh: 「我可沒說。」漢斯說。

en: “What are you saying?”
zh: 「那你在說什麼？」

en: Hans looks out the windshield a moment. He does that Hans thing that Jerry has seen so many times before; he can almost see the gears turning inside his head.
zh: 漢斯透過擋風玻璃向外張望了一會兒，這是漢斯的標誌性動作，傑瑞之前見過很多次，他幾乎可以看到齒輪在他腦子裡飛速轉動。

en: Finally his friend looks back at him.
zh: 他的朋友回頭看著他。

en: “The night she was killed you rang me. You were lost and confused, and I picked you up on the street and you had blood all over your shirt. Just like now.
zh: 「她被殺害的那個晚上你打電話給我，那時你神志不清，我到街上去接你，你的襯衫上到處是血，就跟現在一樣。

en: I asked what had happened, and you said you didn’t know.
zh: 我問你發生了什麼事，你說你不知道。

en: I drove you home. I helped you back through your window.
zh: 我開車送你回家，幫你從窗戶跳進屋子。

en: I sat with you on the couch and you remained quiet for some time, then you begged me not to call the police, and when I asked you what you had done that required the police to be called, you refused to answer. I . . .
zh: 我陪著你坐在沙發上，你一直保持著沉默，接著你央求我不要報警，我問你究竟做了什麼以至於到了要報警的地步，你拒絕回答。

en: for some reason, for some stupid reason, I didn’t call them.
zh: 我……出於某種原因，出於某種愚蠢的原因，沒有打電話報警。

en: Because you were my friend, and what was done was done, and I didn’t call them when I should have.”
zh: 因為你是我的朋友，就算是你做的，我也沒有報警。其實我應該報警的。」

en: For a few moments Jerry’s mind is blank. Absolutely blank.
zh: 過了好一會兒，傑瑞的腦子裡一直都是一片空白，完全的空白。

en: It’s sensory overload. Too much information all in one hit, and he and Henry and even Captain A are all switched off into darkness, but then one simple piece of information sneaks in and reboots his system: he is Jerry Grey and he is a monster. “Jerry?”
zh: 這是感官超負荷的反應，太多的信息擁擠碰撞在一起，他、亨利還有「阿爾茨船長」都陷入深深的黑暗，隨後，一條簡單至極的結論悄然而至，重新啟動了他的意識：他是傑瑞·格雷，他是一個怪物。

en: “Henry wrote those books and it made me crazy. I became one of the monsters he kept writing about.
zh: 「是亨利寫的那些書把我逼瘋了，我也成了他筆下的一個怪物。

en: I really did it?
zh: 我真的幹了那些事？

en: I really hurt these people?”
zh: 我真的傷害了這些人嗎？」

en: “I can’t make the same mistake again, Jerry. I’m sorry, but I have to take you to the police.
zh: 「我不能再犯同樣的錯誤了，傑瑞，我很抱歉，但我必須帶你去自首。

en: We have to let them figure out what’s going on, and most of all we have to make sure you can never hurt anybody else again.”
zh: 我們必須讓他們弄清楚是怎麼回事，最重要的是，要確保你永遠不會再傷害任何人。」
